title.rendered: UK Visa Interview Questions and Answers

content.rendered:
Throughout your time studying in the UK, you must attend at least one interview, and some students may need to attend two. The university’s admissions office conducts the first interview, known as the Pre CAS (Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies) Interview. To gain admission to a UK college or university, it is essential to pass the PRE-CAS interview.

Another important interview that is conducted by the UKVI (UK Visa and Immigration) is the credibility interview, which is also known as the visa interview. The majority of Bangladeshi students now receive UK student visas without having to go through visa interviews. However, some students must attend the visa interview in person, via Skype or Zoom.

We have covered the possible questions and answers for a UK visa interview (both a PRE-CAS interview and a credibility interview, also known as a visa interview) in this guide. You will acquire sufficient interview-preparation ideas here.

Questions for Interviews by University

The following is the essential information for an interview for admission to a UK university.

PRE-CAS Interview: What Is It?

Students must apply for admission through CAS (Confirmation for Acceptance of Studies) in order to study in the UK. As a result, in order to be eligible for CAS, they must participate in a PRE-CAS interview. This interview is conducted online by the university’s admissions department. It will typically take about thirty minutes.

PRE-CAS Interview Sample Questions and Responses

The following are examples of PRE-CAS interview questions and responses. The university conducts the PRE-CAS Interview. For inspiration, let’s look at some examples of questions and answers.

Why do you want to go to college in the UK?

The United Kingdom is one of the most popular study destinations for international students due to its world-class universities and high-quality education. The United Kingdom is a welcoming destination for international students because of its vibrant and multicultural society. In addition, UK degrees are well-known worldwide. This is only a sample response. You can make one that stands out on its own.

Why did you select this college and program?

Clearly and concisely explain to the interviewer why you chose that university and course. Before you sit down for the interview, do some research on the university and the course.

Do you intend to employ UK workers?

I am aware of the regulations that stipulate an international student can only work 20 hours per week. In fact, my primary focus will be on my studies. I can work in accordance with the rules if I am granted additional time in addition to my studies.

What kind of job do you currently hold?

Be honest about your occupation. Simply inform them that you are only a student if you do nothing.

How do your plans for your career relate to your studies?

Specify how your studies will assist you in achieving your career objective if you have any specific career plans.

TIPS – PRE-CAS INTERVIEW

  • Throughout the interview, maintain your self-assurance.
  • Give responses that are honest, precise, and precise.
  • With proper English proficiency, answer.
  • If you don’t understand a question, politely ask the interviewer to repeat it. You could, for instance, say, “Sorry, I couldn’t hear you.” Could you please repeat the question?”
  • Provide accurate figures and facts to back up your responses.
  • Make it clear to the interviewer that you have conducted sufficient research on the university, the course, and the entire study process in the UK.

Interview for UK Visa or Credibility Interview with UKVI, Information You Need to Know

What is a Credibility Interview?

The UK Visas & Immigration (UKVI) conducts a visa interview (also known as a credibility interview) to guarantee that only genuine students will be granted a UK Student Visa. In the UK, one of the most crucial steps in the study process is a credibility interview. can be described as one of the most important steps in applying for a visa.

The responsible person will inquire about all essential information regarding studying in the UK during the Visa interview; such as your goal, interest, financial resources, career strategy, and so on.

What is the scope of a credibility check?

Your UK visa application form and interview help determine whether you are a genuine student. The following is the checklist that the interviewer will use to ask you questions.

  • Education background
  • Family background
  • Financial strength
  • Career plan (both short-term and long-term)
  • The immigration history of the student in the UK and other countries
  • Reasons for choosing a UK university as well as the course.

Who and how does the visa interview take place?

The interview for a UK visa can be conducted in person or electronically. Sometimes, you won’t even need an interview to get a visa. Additionally, a member of the UKVI (United Kingdom Visas and Immigration) staff will conduct the visa interview.

Questions from the British High Commission for the UK Visa Interview (Sample) The most frequently asked questions about the UK student visa interview are listed below. Prepare the response in accordance with your own context. Maintain your self-assurance throughout the interview session to secure admission and a visa.

Questions from the UK Visa Interview about the UK

Why do you want to study in the UK instead of the United States or your nation?

I would prefer to study in the UK rather than the United States or my home country for a few reasons. First and foremost, the educational system in the United Kingdom differs significantly from that in the United States and my home country. Second, the UK is a country with a lot of different cultures, so I think it would be a great chance to meet new people and learn about new cultures.

Last but not least, I would like to study in the United Kingdom because it is generally less expensive than living and studying in the United States.

What if you earn a degree from the UK here? Would you like to return to the UK for further education?

Yes, I would like to return to the UK for further education.

Why did you decide to attend college in the UK?

Is this course not offered by any college or university in the United Kingdom, India, Australia, or Canada?

The education that is provided in the UK is of a world-class standard, as is the teaching. The academic and research facilities at UK universities are of the highest quality. In point of fact, the same course in other nations is not nearly as excellent as it is in the UK. This is why I prefer the UK to other nations.

Why do you want to study in the UK instead of the United States or your nation?

I would prefer to study in the UK rather than the United States or my home country for a few reasons. First and foremost, the educational system in the United Kingdom differs significantly from that in the United States and my home country. Second, the UK is a country with a lot of different cultures, so I think it would be a great chance to meet new people and learn about new cultures.

Last but not least, I would like to study in the United Kingdom because it is generally less expensive than living and studying in the United States.

What if you earn a degree from the UK here?

Would you like to return to the UK for further education?

Yes, I would like to return to the UK for further education.

Why did you decide to attend college in the UK?

Is this course not offered by any college or university in the United Kingdom, India, Australia, or Canada?

The education that is provided in the UK is of a world-class standard, as is the teaching. The academic and research facilities at UK universities are of the highest quality. In point of fact, the same course in other nations is not nearly as excellent as it is in the UK. This is why I prefer the UK to other nations.

Questions about the college and university from the UK Visa Interview

How many universities did you apply to?

Five universities were my choices.

Which schools have you applied to?

I applied to a number of UK universities, including Coventry University, the University of the West of Scotland, the University of Chester, and the University of Roehampton.

Which Schools Took You In?

I’ve been accepted to all of the universities, but I’d rather go to the University of Chester.

How and why did you decide to attend this university?

Because it is one of the UK’s most prestigious universities, I decided to attend this one. A friend of mine who is a current student there introduced me to it.

Could You Please Provide The Names Of A Few Professors?

Yes, I am familiar with the Head of Computer Science, Rafael Params; Deputy Head of Computer Science, Andrew Muncey; Associate Professor Ralph Ferneyhough; Senior Lecturer Lee Beever; and Professor Jules Barnes.

Have You Been Awarded Any Scholarships?

Yes, the University of Scholarships waived a portion of my tuition.

Where is the UK campus of your university?

The campus of my university is in Chester, England.

Questions about your courses from the UK Visa Interview

What Course Are You Taking?

I will pursue a Master of International Business degree.

Why Did You Decide To Take This Class?

I decided to get a master’s degree in international business for many reasons. I have always had an interest in the global economy and international politics. In today’s world, I believe it is essential to have a solid understanding of international business.

I was also drawn to the chance to study abroad and gain a deeper understanding of other cultures. I thought that getting a master’s degree in international business would equip me with the knowledge and skills I needed to succeed in business.

Is It Connected To Your Previous Research?

It is, yes. I have a Bachelor of Business Administration degree, majoring in International Business.

What is the course’s content and structure?

Both the structure and the content of the course cover all important aspects of international business. It matches my interest perfectly.

Why don’t you take this class in your nation?

In comparison to the curriculum at the University of Chester, this course’s curriculum in my country is not particularly impressive. I’ve decided to study in the UK because of this.

How much time will studies take?

The length of my course is one year. Thus, the course will require approximately one year and one month to complete.

What is the start date of the course?

The first day of my course is September 1, 2024. You are required to specify your start date here. This information can be found on your university portal.

Questions about the English language proficiency test from the UK Visa Interview

Have you ever taken an English test?

Yes, I passed the IELTS with a score of 8.5.

I’d like to see your IELTS, TOEFL, and PTE scores.

It is here (share softcopies or display certificates).

Why are your scores low? Why?

You will be asked to answer this question if your score is low. You simply need to explain why. You can let them know that you’re taking a Pre-Sessional English Course in this case.

Do you intend to enroll in a Pre-Session English course?

for B1-level or pre-seasonal English students):

If you enroll in a pre-sessional course, the answer should be “yes.”

How long does your Pre-Sessional English class last?

It could take anywhere from three to six months.

How much will a pre-sessional course cost you?

You are required to specify the precise cost of the course.

Questions about your family from the UK Visa Interview

What does your father do?

My father is an entrepreneur.

Do you have any siblings?

I only have one brother.

How much money does your family make each year?

My family makes more than BDT 5,000,000 annually.

Do you have any siblings or other relatives who are currently enrolled in this university or in the UK?

Actually, no. I do not currently have any relatives in the UK.

Do you have a wife?

No. I’m not married.

If so, how many years have you been married?

I’ve been married for three years.

Where is your partner now?

She has a home in Rajshahi.

Will you take your spouse with you?

She will indeed accompany me. I won’t ever leave her alone.

Your spouse’s qualifications, background, and profession

She just graduated from business school.

Is your spouse familiar with the UK? When and for how long, if so?

You will be asked to respond to this question if your spouse is already in the UK. You simply describe the length of your Why did you decide to move to the UK after your marriage?

The sole reason I am traveling to the UK is to pursue higher education.

Interview for a UK Visa: Questions about your sponsor and financial information

What is your tuition cost? What has been your payment?

£13,200 goes toward my tuition. After going there, I will pay the remaining £8000 that I have already paid.

Who sponsors you?

I’m my own sponsor (could be your parent).

How much money do you have available to pay for your living expenses and tuition in the UK?

I have more than enough money to pay for my living expenses and tuition in the United Kingdom.

What are your sponsor’s sources of income?

I blog as a Study Abroad Blogger and earn a substantial annual income from it.

What evidence do you have to support your sponsor’s ability to fund your studies?

I have evidence of where I get my money.

How many individuals rely on your sponsor?

It can be any number from 3 to 4. In fact, it refers to the number of members of your family.

Could you please show me the bank statements or passbook?

Indeed, it is here.

Read More>>>2024’s Top Ten(10) UK Universities

Questions Regarding Career Prospects in The UK Visa Interview

What is your career objective?

One of the most influential people in the education sector is my career objective. In fact, it is my ideal sector. Through my blog, it will encourage many students worldwide to pursue higher education abroad.

Do you intend to work in the UK while you are pursuing your education or after?

Not really; I’ll just concentrate on my studies.

How can you demonstrate that you will return once your studies are finished?

Bangladesh is a country I adore. Yes, I will return to my nation.

When you get back home, what are you going to do?

I already mentioned that I am a blogger for Study Abroad. Therefore, through my blog, I will work to encourage students to study abroad.

Questions about relatives in the UK from the UK Visa Interview

Do you have any relatives in the UK?

No, there are no relatives in the UK for me.

Do you have any British friends from your university?

Essentially, there are a few Bangladeshi understudies presently concentrating on there. Some of them I know.
